Carbetocin to prevent PPH at CS UHS-CG-0:
1. Carbetocin
2. Postpartum haemorrhage (PPH)
3. Caesarean birth
4. Synthetic analogue of oxytocin
5. Specialist obstetric units
6. Contraindicated
7. Theatre/ODP team
8. Anaesthetist
9. Obstetrician
10. Midwife
11. Administer Carbetocin
12. Umbilical cord clamping
13. Dose: 100 micrograms
14. Diluted with 0.9% sodium chloride
15. Contraindications: pregnancy, labour before birth, hypersensitivity to Carbetocin or oxytocin, hepatic or renal disease, serious cardiovascular disorders, epilepsy, severe eclampsia or pre-eclampsia
16. Cautions: cardiovascular disease, severe hypotension, hyponatraemia or water intoxication, pre-eclampsia or eclampsia, general anaesthesia, migraine, asthma
17. Elimination half-life of Carbetocin: >40 minutes
18. Clinical effect: up to 4 hours
19. 2nd line agent
20. Uterine tone
21. Uterotonic activity
22. Retained placental fragments
23. Blood coagulation disorders
24. Single administration
25. Intramuscular or intravenous
26. Uterotonics
27. Uterine hypotonia or atonia
28. Excessive bleeding
29. Antidiuretic activity
30. Hyponatraemia
31. Interactions with other drugs
32. Adverse effects: anaemia, headache, tremor, nausea, hypotension, flushing, chest pain, dyspnoea, pruritis, back pain, general discomfort
33. Monitoring and review of compliance with guidelines
34. Review of incident cases.
